FuncDef: When enabled, the router sends an ASCII-encoded tuple in thecircuit-idsub-option of the DHCP packet. This ASCII-tuple consists of the access-node-identifier, service-id, and SAP-ID, separated by "|".

ParaDef.Info: Specifies that the ASCII-encoded concatenated tuple consisting of the access-node-identifier, service-id, and interface-name is used.

Specifies that the format will include VLAN-id and dot1p bits in addition to what is included in ascii-tuple already. The format is supported on dot1q and qinq ports only. Thus, when the option 82 bits are stripped, dot1p bits is copied to the Ethernet header of an outgoing packet.
